intro: Helosciadium gracile, commonly known as slender false pennywort, is a small, herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors or along stream banks. The plant has small, opposite leaves that are usually rounded or ovate in shape. Its flowers are tiny, yellow, and clustered in dense, umbel-like inflorescences. Helosciadium gracile is often found in damp soils and can thrive in partial to full shade.
